div.head: Using the Text Encoding Initiative for Digital Scholarly Editions
Lou Burnard (Lou Burnard Consulting), Marjorie Burghart (EHESS /DiXiT), Magdalena Turska (IT Services / DiXiT), James Cummings (IT Services / DiXiT)

head.placeName: Wolfson College, Room To Be Confirmed
IT Services, Room To Be Confirmed

div.head: Workshop Abstract
div.p: The Guidelines of the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) are widely used in the production of digital scholarly editions of primary sources. This workshop combines lectures describing relevant parts of the latest version of the TEI P5 Guidelines with practical exercises reinforcing the topics covered. It includes an introduction to TEI-XML markup, explanations of relevant aspects of the TEI Guidelines, and discussion about approaches to publishing TEI. We don't cover every part of the TEI Guidelines, but focus on how they help you transcribe, describe, edit, and publish primary source materials in digital form.

div.head: Prerequisites
div.p: No previous expertise in using the TEI or XML is required, but participants should have basic IT skills. Please bring along samples of source material you intend to work on.
